comments.text:
I have an app tab now that always asks if I am *really* sure I want to leave the page when I close the browser. This sucks.

A few ideas I had:
1) Allow a global preference that ignores onunload when we are closing a window. Simple and effective.
2) Allow a global preference that ignores onunload always.
3) Add a per-site preference that will add a checkbox to the "Stay on Page" dialog which, if not checked, will never ask this question again for the site.

I'm leaning towards 1, since it's easy and gets the job done for me. :) It also will leave the dialog for cases when I'm accidentally closing a tab with unsaved changes.

Here's a good place to do something:
http://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/browser/base/content/browser.js#6426

comments.raw_text:
1 seems like a reasonable way to start, but the edge case seems tricky. If you're closing a window with only 1 tab, do you ignore onunload?.

Perhaps what you want is to ignore onunload when quitting?
